message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NA, cs.AR, cs.CE, cs.PL

Reasoning: 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper discusses SpMV on various platforms including CPUs, GPUs, and Xeon Phi, which are commonly used in distributed, parallel, and cluster computing. 
- cs.NA (Numerical Analysis): The paper proposes a new storage format for SpMV, which is a fundamental building block for numerous numerical analysis applications. 
- cs.AR (Hardware Architecture): The paper evaluates the performance of the proposed format and algorithm on various hardware architectures, including CPUs, GPUs, and Xeon Phi. 
- cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper discusses the performance of the proposed format and algorithm on a benchmark suite of regular and irregular matrices, which are commonly used in computational engineering, finance, and science. 
- cs.PL (Programming Languages): The paper provides the source code of the proposed format and algorithm, which can be downloaded and used by researchers and practitioners in programming languages such as C and CUDA.
